out_desc_attend: Mean and SD for number of days attended out of 60

health_outcomes_menst_health_info: monitoring or menstrual management, i.e. checking whether there are enough pads
health_outcomes_sexual_health_info: tests on reproductive health and attitudes (no sig. difference between the control and pads only group

out_desc_attend: Attendance over the 60 day period in which students were monitored
out_desc_other_outcome: School engagement means and SD's from the posttest in which ppts were given a score of 0-8 on questionnaire regarding concentration during etc
intervention_dur_na_info: not provided but participants were given 25 sessions from over approximately an 18 month period
only provided menstrual cup once and monitored for 10 months

out_desc_abs: Mean and SD for absenteeism durin random spot-checks conducted by researchers, sanitary pad group vs control.

out_desc_attend: Attendance (Education only vs control)  Post-treatment means/SD

Attendance  Pads+Educa vs control (Percent of school days attended across sites over time)  Means, SDs post-test (they say that there are no differences in baseline btu don't seems very similar either, non-randomised trial)
Pad provision and education vs control in girls' school attendance

health_outcomes_menst_health_info: measured accurate knowledge about girls' own menstruation, measurements of feelings of shame associated with menstruation after the intervention

out_desc_attend: attendance on days of menstruation treatment v control

out_desc_dropout: difference in school dropout between those receiving cups or pads and control  (see slack for calculation method)
